org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl
Class AeBpelState

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.AeBpelState
public class AeBpelState
extends java.lang.Object

Models the state of a bpel object. A Bpel object must be in one of the following states: INACTIVE, READY_TO_EXECUTE, EXECUTING, FINISHED, FAULTED, DEAD_PATH, QUEUED_BY_PARENT

Constant Field Values

INACTIVE

public static final AeBpelState INACTIVE
All Bpel objects are in the inactive state when the Process starts

READY_TO_EXECUTE

public static final AeBpelState READY_TO_EXECUTE
Describes objects that are ready to execute. These objects have been queued by their parent and their join condition has evaluated to true

EXECUTING

public static final AeBpelState EXECUTING
Describes objects that are currently executing

FINISHED

public static final AeBpelState FINISHED
Describes objects that have finished executing w/o a fault

FAULTED

public static final AeBpelState FAULTED
Describes objects that have finished executing with a fault

DEAD_PATH

public static final AeBpelState DEAD_PATH
Describes objects that have been removed from the execution path due to dead path elimination

QUEUED_BY_PARENT

public static final AeBpelState QUEUED_BY_PARENT
Describes objects that have been queued for execution by parent

TERMINATED

public static final AeBpelState TERMINATED
Describes objects that have been terminated

FAULTING

public static final AeBpelState FAULTING
Describes objects that are in the process of faulting (suspended due to an uncaught fault).

logInvalidStateChange

private static void logInvalidStateChange(IAeBpelObject aObject,
                                          AeBpelState aNewState,
                                          AeBpelState currentState)
Logs the invalid state change to the process log

Parameters:
aObject -
aNewState -

canTransitionToDeadPath

public boolean canTransitionToDeadPath()
Returns true if this state can transition to dead path.

linksBecomeFalse

public boolean linksBecomeFalse()
Returns true if the state is one in which an activity's links are set to false when the activity enters it. This is true for faulted, dead path, and terminated states.

isFinal

public boolean isFinal()
Returns true if the state is final, meaning that it will not naturally transition into another state. These states include: Finished, Faulted, Dead Path, and Terminated. The other states are not considered final since they will likely transition into one of the final states. Unknown will go to Ready or Dead Path, Ready will go to Executing, Faulted, or Dead Path Executing will go into Finished or Faulted

getCode

public int getCode()
Getter for the code, used in the lookup for the allowable state transitions

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns the name of the state. Useful for debugging only.

See Also:
Object.toString()

isPropagable

public boolean isPropagable()
Returns true if the state should be propagated to child objects.

getStateForPropagation

public AeBpelState getStateForPropagation()
Returns the state object that we're going to propagate. This is not necessarily the same state as was set on the parent object. For example, if a parent object enters the executing state, then its child objects should be set to the inactive since they may have already executed once.

propagate

public void propagate(IAeBpelObject aObject)
               throws AeBusinessProcessException
Propagates the objects state change to its children.

Parameters:
aObject -
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

isTerminatable

public boolean isTerminatable()
Reports whether an object in this state can be terminated. Final states cannot be terminated. Neither can inactive and finished sans links.

getName

private java.lang.String getName()
Returns this state's name.

getStatesMap

private static java.util.Map getStatesMap()
Returns map of state names to state objects.

forName

public static AeBpelState forName(java.lang.String aName)
                           throws AeBusinessProcessException
Returns the instance of AeBpelState whose name is aName.

Parameters:
aName - the state's name.
Returns:
AeBpelState the state whose name is aName.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException
